edu.biu.scapi.midLayer

Class SecretKeyGeneratorUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.SecretKeyGeneratorUtil

  • public class SecretKeyGeneratorUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class generates a SecretKey in a single step. There are two possibilities for creation. One requires the size of the key -a value greater than zero-, and the other does not. Both require the name of the algorithm for which to generate the key and a source of randomness.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)

    • Method Detail

      • generateKey

        public static javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(int keySize,
                                 java.lang.String algName,
                                 java.security.SecureRandom random)
        This static function generates a SecretKey. It looks for a default provider implementation for the algorithm name requested. If found then uses it. Otherwise it creates the Key using SecretKeyGeneratorSpi. This function should be used when the key size is known. It requires a key size greater than zero, otherwise it throws NegativeArraySizeException.
        Parameters:
        keySize - The size of the requested key in bits.
        algName - The name of the algorithm for which to generate the key.
        random - The source of randomness to use.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException

      • generateKey

        public static javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(java.lang.String algName,
                                 java.security.SecureRandom random)
                                          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This static function generates a SecretKey. It looks for a default provider implementation for the algorithm name requested. If found then uses it. Otherwise it creates the Key using SecretKeyGeneratorSpi. This function is useful if there is a default key size for the requested algorithm, and there is a default provider implementation for it.
        Parameters:
        algName - The name of the algorithm for which to generate the key.
        random - The source of randomness to use.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • generateKey

        public static javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(java.lang.String algName)
                                          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This static function generates a SecretKey. It looks for a default provider implementation for the algorithm name requested. If found then uses it. Otherwise it creates the Key using SecretKeyGeneratorSpi. This function is useful if there is a default key size for the requested algorithm, and there is a default provider implementation for it. This function uses SCAPI's default source of randomness.
        Parameters:
        algName - The name of the algorithm for which to generate the key.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
